Here's my statement tonight on defeating ISIS:pic.twitter.com/6VyxmXzFeV
In the House, we stand ready to work with the President on aggressive measures to confront and defeat the serious threat of ISIS.
The House will soon pass bipartisan legislation to reform the troubled visa waiver program—an important step in keeping America safe.
The American people deserve to know their government is doing everything in its power to keep them safe from terrorist attacks.
ISIS is not contained, much less defeated. The President's speech offered no indication he will change his approach so we can defeat ISIS.
To defeat ISIS, America needs strong leadership and a strong strategy. It's clear that President Obama's current approach isn't working.

MYTH 8: FTAs hurt hard-working taxpayers. FACT: #TPA gives American workers a competitive edge. http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
MYTH 7: #TPP is a secret backdoor. FACT: Nothing is implemented via TPP unless Congress votes and approves http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
MYTH 6: FTAs undermine US sovereignty. FACT: Congress may override an entire agreement any time by a simple statute http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
MYTH 5: #TPP is being negotiated in secret FACT: When TPA passes the public has months to review TPP b4 Congress acts http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
MYTH 4: Congress has no power under #TPA. FACT: Congress has plenary authority over rules of procedure. http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
MYTH 3: #TPA sets binding congressional rules for US trade talks. FACT: TPA sets congressional negotiating objectives http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
MYTH 2: #TPA grants POTUS new/unlimited powers. FACT: The Constitution gives Congress the power to control trade. http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
MYTH 1: #TPA is unconstitutional. FACT: Congress retains its authority to approve/reject all future trade agreements. http://bit.ly/1FOxNO6
